intro: Simira aristeguietae, commonly known as the Ecuadorian simira, is a shrub native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white flowers that bloom in spring. Its fruits are small berries that turn red when mature, attracting various bird species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
